page.title: 08FLEED FARM,WIVELISCOMBE (1)
page.content:
At Fleed Farm, there are 120 Fresian cows. The herringbone parlour holds 12 cows, and milks 6 at a time. The milk is stored in two steel tanks ready for collection. At the factory, it is made into milk powder, butter and cheese.
The cows eat as much grass as possible in the fields in the summer months. In the winter months, they each eat about 42kg of silage. In winter they are bedded down on straw, in cubicles in sheds. When they are milked they eat cow cake (about 9kg/year) according to what milk they give.
After calving, each cow will give between 25 and 45 litres of milk a day. In a year, they will give between 5,000 and 9,000 litres. Mr Bale starts milking at 5 o'clock in the morning and 5 o'clock in the afternoon.
